clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Remote Ischemic Preconditioning Applied in Children the Day Before Open Heart Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: The Use of Remote Ischemic Preconditioning Applied in Child the Day Before Open Heart Surgery With Extracorporeal Circulation to Correct Congenital Heart Diseases (the Second Window Effect)

brief_summary.textblock: The study research is to analyse brief episodes of limb ischemia applied to children the day before open heart surgery as protection from myocardial injury induced by extracorporeal circulation.

detailed_description.textblock: Children undergoing repair of congenital heart defects were randomized to RIPC (remote ischemic preconditioning) or control treatment. RIPC was induced by four 5-minutes cycles of lower limb ischemia and reperfusion using a blood pressure cuff. Measurements of troponin I, brain natriuretic peptide, interleukines 8 and 10, real time PCR to NFKB and clinical parameters were obtained and compared postoperatively (4, 12, 24 and 48 hous after).

primary_outcome.description: Expressure of gene of an inhibitory protein called kappa-B alpha (IkB-alpha). Inhibits the inflammatory response protein called kappa-B nuclear factor. To measure that expression we used a real time protein chain reaction (RT-PCR), always comparing with an endogenous protein expression (this way, the encountered value is apresented in "arbitraries units", that means how much times the expression of the protein IkB-alpha is bigger than the endogenous protein that present a invariable value.
Quantification of interlecine 8 (a pro-inflammatory protein) using the ELISA method

secondary_outcome.description: Plasma concentration of the amino-terminal of B-type natriuretic peptite (NT-proBNP)was measured by enzyme electrochemiluminescence immunoassay.
Seric concentration of troponin I, a myocardial cell injury marker. We measured by solid-phase chemiluminescence immunoassay.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1 month to 2 years age
- waiting for open heart surgery in hospital
- 2008, january to march
- Rachs-1, except the 1 category
Exclusion Criteria:
- genetic syndromes
- infected children
- immunodeficiency
- immunosuppressor use
- no parents permission
